images.caption: Tarn Beck and remains of spoil heaps at Tindale

description: This walk explores the RSPB's Geltsdale Nature Reserve and the pretty Tindale Tarn in the North Pennines. There's some fine scenery here with becks, hills and old quarries to see. The area is also great for wildlife with black grouse, curlews, and birds of prey like the hen harrier to look out for. You can start your walk from the RSPB car park at the western end of the site, just south of Hallbankgate. From here you can pick up walking trails heading east towards Tarnhouse Rigg, Tindale Tarn and the village of Tindale. You can then turn around and head west past the old quarries and Bruthwaite Forest to Howgill. Here you turn north to head past Tortie Hill and return to the car park.
